page.title: 07HOUSING,EMPLOYMENT,TRANSPORT
page.content: A survey of the school's catchment area within the study area provided us with information. Most lived in semi- detached houses and most people had at least three bedrooms and a garden large enough for children to play in. Housing was either council rented or privately owned. Most houses have at least two children and two adults. Nearly all homes had one person in full-time employment but 25% had one person in the home unemployed. 13% were single parent families. There was a nearly equal distribution of those people who attended church regularly, rarely or nver and people were predominately Church of England in denomination. The most popular way of getting to work was on foot or by car. Bicycles were also quite popular but users of public transport were very small in number.
